#text=When you have a flat bicycle tire the first thing you need to do is see where the hole is originating from .
#text=You have to fully unscrew the tire first and take off the outer rubber .
#text=Then you have to take off the inner rubber tube off of the tire frame .
#text=Once you have the inner tube try to find a body of water .
#text=Most easy method is filling the tire back up with air and listening for the sound .
#text=Another method is filling a bucket with water if you are at home .
#text=Once the inner tube is submerged in the water you should be able to see bubbles coming out of the hole .
#text=Once you identify where the puncture is you have to dry the area first before using either a specific tape or glue to plug up the hole .
#text=Verify once you repaired the hole place the tube back on the frame and fill it back up with air .
